PARAGRAPH.STRING: , officially the Union of Myanmar (pronounced [IPA: [pjìdàunzṵ mjəmà nàinŋàndɔ̀]]) is the largest country by geographical area in mainland Southeast Asia. Also known as Burma or the Union of Burma by bodies and states which do not recognize the ruling military junta,

is bordered by the People's Republic of China on the north, Laos on the east, Thailand on the southeast, Bangladesh on the west, and India on the northwest, with the Andaman Sea to the south, and the Bay of Bengal to the southwest. One-third of
total perimeter, 1,930 km (1,199 mi), forms an uninterrupted coastline.
diverse population has played a major role in defining
politics, history and demographics in modern times.
political system remains under the tight control of the State Peace and Development Council, the military government led by Senior General Than Shwe since 1992. Part of the British Empire until 1948,
ethnic tensions and overcome coups d'état.
culture, heavily influenced by neighbours, is based on a unique form of Buddhism intertwined with local elements.
